snippet: Jerry Delakas had run the stand on Astor Place in the East Village for 26 years, but the city closed it in December because he never obtained the required license.
abstract: Jerry Delakas ran newsstand on Astor Place in the East Village for 26 years, but the city closed it in December because he had never obtained the required license; Delakas is filing new license application appealing order locking the stand; some in the neighborhood support his attempts to reopen the stand, saying that he had provided rare continuity in a changing landscape.
lead_paragraph: Jerry Delakas had run the stand on Astor Place in the East Village for 26 years, but the city closed it in December because he never obtained the required license.

headline.main: On a Changing East Village Street, a Source of Continuity Fights for His Job
headline.print_headline: On a Changing East Village Street, a Source of Continuity Fights for His Job
